intro: Ranunculus sardous var. rhoeadifolius, commonly known as the yellow buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features a basal rosette of deeply lobed, bright yellow flowers with a distinctive green center. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and palmately divided leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
